metadata.title: CVE-2017-5403 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
When adding a range to an object in the DOM, it is possible to use"addRange" to add the range to an incorrect root object. This triggers ause-after-free, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 52 and Thunderbird < 52.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5403` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
